name: @installdoc/common-python
description: Common files and boilerplates for Python projects
author: Brian Zalewski <brian@megabyte.space> (https://megabyte.space)

scripts.bump: npm run build && npm version patch --no-commit-hooks --no-git-tag-version --force && npm publish
scripts.prepare: bash start.sh && (test -f Taskfile.yml && task npm:prepare) || true

blueprint.description: Common files and boilerplates for Python projects
blueprint.name: Python Common
blueprint.overview: This repository hosts common files and boilerplate files for Python projects. The common files are stored in this repository and synchronized with downstream Python projects to keep shared files used in Python projects up-to-date. This repository also hosts boilerplate code that is injected into a Python project if it appears to be a new one.
blueprint.title: Python Common Files and Boilerplates

descriptions.build: Builds the project using the build command specified under scripts in package.json
descriptions.bump: Used to quickly build, increase the package.json version, and publish the package
descriptions.commit: If unsure, use this task to commit your code so that it adheres to our commit rules
descriptions.fix: Run auto-fixing with all available auto-fixers
descriptions.help: Display the Bodega Taskfile.yml interactive help menu
descriptions.lint: Lint the project with all available linters
descriptions.preload: Preload the operating system with commonly used libraries and tools
descriptions.prepare: A hook triggered by running npm install that runs logic such as installing pre-commit hooks
descriptions.publish: Publish the software to all supported channels using semantic-release
descriptions.release: Publish the software to all supported channels using semantic-release
descriptions.repair: Fixes basic issues in projects that are having trouble running basic commands like 'task start'
descriptions.start: Entrypoint for new developers that installs requirements and then runs 'task start'
descriptions.test: Runs the appropriate test logic by running the test command defined under scripts in package.json
descriptions.unpack: Populates production node_modules from compressed copies saved in the .modules/ folder
descriptions.update: Update and refresh the repository with upstream changes and templated parts
